page.title: 07BLEWBURY SCHOOL
page.content: WITH THE PASSING OF THE 1902 EDUCATION ACT,THE CONTROL PASSED TO THE BERKSHIRE EDUCATION COMMITTEE THROUGH A LOCAL BOARD OF SIX MANAGERS.THE LARGE JUNIOR ROOM WAS EXTENDED TO THE SOUTH BY A BAY IN 1902,WHEN THE MAIN ROOMS WERE ACCOMMODATING ABOUT 125 CHILDREN.WITH THE GREATLY INCREASED POPULATION OF BLEWBURY IN THE 1960'S,AN'OVERFLOW' CLASS HAD TO BE HOUSED IN THE VILLAGE HALL IN 1962.IN DECEMBER OF THE FOLLOWING YEAR,THE NEW BUILDINGS IN WESTBROOK STREET WERE OCCUPIED BY THE TWO JUNIOR CLASSES,SO ALLOWING THE DISPLACED INFANT CLASS TO RETURN 'HOME' THE NEW BUILDINGS WERE OFFICIALLY OPENED IN MARCH 1964.SINCE 1974,OWING TO THE CHANGE IN COUNTY BOUNDARIES, BLEWBURY SCHOOL IS UNDER THE CONTROL OF THE OXFORSHIRE EDUCATION COMMITTEE BUT STILL REMAINS A CHURCH SCHOOL.
